name: The Elven Deathless Rogue (Rogue 19 / Wizard 5 / Pale Master 16)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Elven Deathless Rogue


Image source: https://www.pinterest.com.au/pin/404479610266872836/


Rogue / Pale Master is an unexplored build combination. I would rate a difficult to kill rogue sneaker as a pretty difficult opponent to face!

Probably the most eminent example of such a build is Kail Pendragon's Pale Sneaker of Doom (and Paler Sneaker of Doom) which are Halfling Rogue/Bard/Pale Masters.

This build I use Wizard as the secondary class, make it an elf.
It gets a wizard spell book, up to level 6 wizard spells, which is largely for summons so you can sneak em and some low level buffs and scroll and wand crafting. 
Buffs like Stoneskin, Improved Invisibility, Flame Weapon and Cats Grace/Endurance are highly valuable as well as the ability to craft wands of Shadow Conjuration for the 7 caster level darkness spell for a bit of darkness/ultravision power sneak killing power. 

Lots of skill points, 10d6 sneak attack, 5-6 APR / round dual shortswords. Epic dodge and Improved evasion. +18 AC from Tumble 40 and PM 10. Critical hit/Sneak Attack immunity. EMA / EW.
Best specialty school if you have to have one, is likely going to be Illusionist at the cost of enchantment school (prot vs spells, mass haste would be the main spells you would miss).
With Dex near capped or with +5 to set trap via items or one with the land scrolls, this guy can set epic traps.
Slippery mind I put at the end for something to look forward to when you hit level 40.

One build uses the same class combinations, malibu-fr's Dodgy Tank which was designed as a rapier and shield wielder in PvP, with all the sneak attack damage / hit I thought dual wielding would be cooler, along with having Wiz 6 spells in PvM. WoG players will look forward to Wiz 6 with the ability to scribe PnP TT scrolls for a huge AB boost in combat and +1 APR.

Anyway, have put this up to see if there are any suggestions or thoughts before I start play testing this one. Thanks for reading!

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: For a pointy ear he looks smart and competent.  He can be in my party any day of the week. You may get some suggestions to use Bard instead of Wizard to qualify for PM.  While there is some merit to that, what the wizard offers instead is you have spell casting from 1st to 6th spells.  You have scribe and craft wand, so you can self-sustain yourself with an unlimited supply of Summon Wands, Invis Wands, Improved Invis/Stone Skin Wands, and scribe some Bigby's Interloping Hand among other good choices.  You won't rely on these buffs, but enemy casters will foolishly waste a round to dispel your 5th level caster level buffs from you while you're jamming an elven cake knife in their ear socket.

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
This build makes me even more anxious for Beamdog to fix Pale Master caster levels. What a build it would be!

Also, this build would benefit greatly from any gear item with +INT for that sweet level 7 spell slot.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
It's like this one is a companion piece to your gnomish Mestil's Crafty Emissary and Juggernaut builds, but this time going Rogue and PM heavy, rather than wizard. I'll confess that I prefer this one (can't think why...).

See, I do read the stuff members generate, despite rumours to the contrary!

Cheers

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
This one looks really good, Orion!

Gonna have to give it a spin!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: I like it. I is an interesting twist to the classic Rogue/ Wizard.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: I believe you can go Halfling as well in this build, avoid XP penalty, and gain 1 point of AB and AC (and +1 to all saves). Knockdown would lose some value.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks GDL for your comment, I had been thinking about a halfling variant 
For this to work well I would drop toughness and take improved knockdown somewhere, change the weapon to dual daggers
The build would end up with the same HP and IKD helps the smaller statured types knockdown opponents successfully
I believe it would be not ideal to give up blind fight for IKD as I believe you need this for the Darkness/Ultravision combo
More AB is very attractive, 38 is ok, but 39 is better as you note along with better stealth and listen/spot bonuses from small size, traded for Keen Senses, a little bit of str, extra base damage from shortswords and longbow proficiency
A human would get IKD and a bunch of skill points which are unnecessary at the cost of some dex/AB (ie AB 37), but more AB means a more powerful build I think elf or halfling is best overall, maybe even gnome...

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: Dual Wield Kukris *drools*

posts.author: Yogmister7
posts.content:
Hello Orion.
Great build.. And as an admirer of your builds I am already level 11 and looking good!

Why do much PM levels?won't it be worth it to take more wizard or rogue power?

Sent from my Redmi 4 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: PM15 is needed for access to Epic Spell feats, PM16 gives an extra PM bonus feat (in particular another Epic Spell) and +2 AC. If you want Epic Dodge, PM10, and Epic Spells then you must have PM15 in the build, the extra PM level is for an optimal class spread.

posts.author: Yogmister7
posts.content:
I see Yunim, thanks for the info.

Really like the unique style of this build



Sent from my Redmi 4 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
When I experimented with assassin builds, I tried different approaches with wizard. One combination was with PM as third class. PM has the stealth skills as class skills and can qualify early for assassin. I wanted to keep assassin levels as high as possible (you know me), and tried Wizard 4/ PM 10/ Assassin 26 with level 5 spells. But I finally leaned more towards Wizard 10/ PM 2/ Assassin 28 and level 6 spells. The AC was better with the first. The caster level and DA better with the second. I started out with PM to get stealth skills, but saw the synergy with wizard too. So the W4/PM10/A26 spread was the closest I got to your build here, Orion. So no epic spells for me.
Edit:I tried both Elf and Halfling. Halfling has better AB, AC and stealth. Elf has better detection.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Yogmister7, Mick and Yunim
Very grateful for your comments, interest and encouragement
And thank you for your warm complements, it encourages me to keep learning and exploring different ideas which are hopefully fun

Yunim is correct  I designed the build to fit in EMA/EW with PM 15(general epic feat)-16 (bonus PM feat)
I liked Yogmister7's comment and suggestion to look at dropping PM down because EMA/EW are in the build at level 39, which is pretty late, most modules finish by then.
And glad Mick also decided to drop EMA/EW with his assassin, its one of those things that are nice but non-essential, PM 10 provides a lot already (in this build it has Epic Dodge as well as UMD/Crafting Wiz wands up to 4, heaps of defenses)

I discussed this a bit with Yogmister7 and designed a Rogue 24 / PM 10 / W 6 split
It had 13d6 sneak attack vs 10d6 sneak attack, better fort save (epic fortitude) and better skill points at the cost of EER, EMA/EW and 4 PM AC
With epic dodge, crit/sneak immunity, and the ability to make heaps of great wands, I am unsure if so many defensive feats was the best balance so I considered whether more sneak would be better
He was keen for Wizard 6 spells for the ability to scribe PnP TT scrolls on WoG hence the split.
He liked improved critical with dual shortswords which I thought one could swap for toughness although one will go a little low on HP (sub 300) there are ways around it especially being crit/sneak immune.

This is what I designed

I think I like a Rogue 25 / PM 10 / W 5 split with Int dropped to 14 and Con increased to 14 I believe could have 14d6 sneak and toughness can be swapped for another feat, if one is happy to Wiz 4 spells to craft wands. If I were a rogue who could make up to wizard 4 wands I'd be pretty happy :) Lots of great Wiz 4 spells. I might start exploring this idea soon.

Thanks for exploring this with me by the way. Great to have your collective experience on board.
